title.label: Love the music, love the story, love the game style

I could not have said it any better. This game is something that I have never seen before and playing this just absolutely blew my mind. The graphics are just beautiful and the aesthetic is very retro yet very original. The soundtrack is just beautiful as well, I can get listen to every song hour on hours of repeating them to get the gold rank. It is a game that just defines almost everything that I wanted to see in a video game.

This is not a fake post. I‚Äôve been playing video games since my 7200 Atari and I have never had a game that made me cry. This game is beautiful with one of the best sound tracks I have ever heard. As a father of five I want my little girls to play this and any other woman in my life that needs a pick me up. Outstanding to the crew who made this. I can‚Äôt say enough about this game. Play it and pass it on. Thank you so much . -Amp

Holy crap! This game is pretty good. The music is not too much of my taste but the visuals totally distract me from that. Everything is so bright and colorful and so cool to look at. The music and the visuals are very compatible with each other and I love it. I do have one small problem though. It‚Äôs the way you are allowed to move the character. Yes, I love how you can move very freely and the game does not restrict you. However, it feels stiff and to move the character around quickly to dodge projectiles can be rather hard and sometimes frustrating. I do like the fact that they give you the opinion to skip that section of the level if you get stuck. The story isn‚Äôt too hard to follow but if you lose the main plot of the story, head right to the first level and the description of the game in the App Store. I would like another thing like this game and I would like for it to be a bit longer please

It doesn‚Äôt stop at the style and the gameplay of this game. It has so much to offer from music to the story and might give you a fun challenge. Sayonara is a wonderful game that I absolutely recommend you play with headphones. I cannot express how good of a job the dev team did on this game! 

So what are you waiting for? Give it a go!
I hope this game comes out with more levels. It‚Äôs so amazing on Apple TV! Plus the music and the animations are mesmerizing.

I heard a lot of good things about this game and IT DIDN'T DISAPPOINT ! The music and the graphics are beyond beautiful, I enjoyed it so much that I even bought it on my ps4 ! Everyone needs to play this, I promise you‚Äôll love it as much as I do

This game has great visuals and music. It's a little short but makes up for it with replayability.

Honestly, I love this game! The art is so visually pleasing and the music is even better! I recommend this if you are bored on a car ride or just bored. But it‚Äôs a bit hard, I could just be me though.not only that, but I love the idea of ballet and battling. It is also kind of giving off a ‚Äúgirl power‚Äù vibe, which I also love. It‚Äôs sort of a fast and furious but filled with girls.

In the end. I recommend this to anyone!

This game is absolutely dripping with cool. Even more than a great game, it‚Äôs an experience. From the music to the art, I‚Äôve been totally captivated with it from beginning to end! 

One note for the developers however, the controls make the game much harder than it has to be. Even with touch sensitivity set to high, I have a hard time swerving from side to side in time, especially in the harder levels. 

Overall I love this game, and can‚Äôt recommend it enough!
This is the best game in Apple Arcade Highly recommended... I don‚Äôt want to spoil it just download and play..

This game is incredible. The soundtrack is amazing and the gameplay is a little confusing at first but is easy to get the hang of. There is a definite feminine feel to the game but if you look past that the game is amazing.
Wow, beautiful game. Hard to describe, but I said ‚Äúwhoah‚Äù quite a bit.

Stunning visuals, frustrating controls, dizzying perspective changes (and not necessarily in a good way). There are also irritating frame rate drops that kill the immersion of an otherwise buttery smooth experience. I feel that if I were to play this game again I would get a migraine.
I want to be able to get a gold rank on the first stage without having to watch the same cutscene over and over

This game was so gorgeous to play. The music is great, as made evident by the trailer (and you can download the soundtrack). Every moment of Sayonara was neon pink-filled joy. If you love over the top anime flourishes, you will find this immensely satisfying. My only complaint would be that I‚Äôd like the songs to be longer! Sometimes the levels finishes right when I‚Äôm getting into the beat. I realize this would increase development costs, but I think it‚Äôs a great opportunity for a sequel! (Played with a controller, which I found great.)

Edit: I‚Äôve now replayed this game many times and have listened to the soundtrack over and over again. I retract my comment about longer songs. This is the perfect length. I love that this is a pop album game, not a rhythm game with 200 levels. Instead, make more [games] albums!

This game is absolutely stunning. It is not just one of the my favorite mobile games, it competes with some of my favorite games in general. It is a breath of fresh air. The game play, even-though simple, brings something new and great in almost every level. An absolute must have especially if you rhythm games.

The game is beautiful and the music is amazing. The largest problem with the fame is how clunky it feels. The controls get changed constantly and there‚Äôs no direction on what to do it‚Äôs just trial and error. It feels like they didn‚Äôt play test the game because sometimes when trying to turn or steer it feels so unnatural and you can‚Äôt even turn what looks like a simple corner. Each level is different, which is very nice, but the controls change so you never know what to expect. I go to pick up the game and play half a level and quickly put it down because I remember how awful it feels to feel so extremely out of control of your character.
Games seems good and interesting but i had no sound.

Sayonara Wild Hearts is one of the most engaging and beautiful indies I have ever played. Its mix of fluid movement and catchy beats made me feel as if I was in a calming and surreal dream.

The controls are intuitive enough. Sometimes it felt like the stock sensitivity was just way too slow. Thankfully after I changed it I was able to play perfectly fine. The QTE bits that I was worried about felt... well... like they weren‚Äôt out of place or slowed the pace of the game. I did a couple of times wonder why you couldn‚Äôt tap anywhere when the prompts appeared. I felt like my hand got in the way of many beautiful animations.

Graphics and music is where this game really excels though. There were many times I found myself jaw a gape and humming along with the incredibly palpable soundtrack. Though a funny mental image it really is a testament of how this game really bends your mind to its will.

Though I had a few gripes with the controls it wasn‚Äôt a big enough problem to hold the game at fault. I still find myself humming the soundtrack to myself and believe that this game will be around for a while. I believe in it‚Äôs staying power. It‚Äôs a beautiful reminder of how poignant indies can truly be. Thank you for such a great and memorable experience.

If the mechanic of this game is just to switch lanes, there should be dedicated toggles at the bottom of the screen. Definitely sacrificed the controls making sense for the aesthetic. Everything else is amazing.

I enjoyed this game right away.  But like many, was frustrated with the touch controls. As soon as I used my controller, it made a WORLD of difference! Super fun! Can‚Äôt wait to go back through and get gold on everything! Game is seriously beautiful and music is top notch!

Playing this on my phone is next to impossible to enjoy. I really want to like this game but moving across the screen at the speed in which the game moves doesn‚Äôt coincide when moving the character from left to right.

title.label: If you could just get past the intro...

content.label: This game would be great.  I don‚Äôt understand why you have to sit through that movie everytime you play.

I really really want to like this game and play through it, but it‚Äôs too frustrating for me. I‚Äôm an older person and my reflexes aren‚Äôt what they were when I spent hours playing Tempest in the arcade. This very much reminds me of that, but with so much more style and features. I love the music and the graphical style and the design!

I know it tries to be forgiving with retries, but I have to retry too many times. That breaks up the flow of the game, so it‚Äôs just not fun.

Great concept and style but control is terrible. I swipe fully from right to left but my character barely moves, making me crash constantly. There‚Äôs absolutely no reason to make things this difficult, especially for the first levels.
